title: Add mock Australian Visa Check with custom per-application status

requirements.text: Add backend support for a mock Australian visa application status registry keyed by (Application ID, Email) where authenticated users can create, update, list, and delete custom status entries (no integration with any external/government systems).

quotes: make australia work visa satatus check website when applicant can check visa application id and email

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes new methods to create/update a status entry for a given Application ID + Email pair, and to delete it.
Backend exposes a method to list the current caller’s saved status entries.
All create/update/delete/list operations require an authenticated user (same authorization pattern as existing visa record CRUD).
No calls are made to any external endpoints; all status values are user-defined and stored internally.

requirements.text: Add a backend query method that allows checking the stored custom status by providing Application ID and Email, returning the matching entry (or null if none exists).

quotes: make australia work visa satatus check website when applicant can check visa application id and email

acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes a query that takes Application ID and Email and returns the stored custom status entry (or null).
The query performs an exact match on both Application ID and Email.
If no entry exists for the pair, the query returns null (and does not trap).

requirements.text: Create a new frontend page/screen labeled "Australian Visa Check" that lets a user enter Application ID and Email, submit, and view the returned custom status (or a clear "No status found" message).

quotes: make australia work visa satatus check website when applicant can check visa application id and email

acceptanceCriteria: The screen includes input fields for Application ID and Email and a primary action to check status.
On submit, the UI calls the backend check query and renders the returned status data when present.
When no entry is found, the UI shows a user-friendly empty-state message in English (e.g., "No status found for that Application ID and email.").
The screen uses existing Tailwind/Shadcn styling conventions and is responsive.

requirements.text: Provide an authenticated management UI for custom statuses where signed-in users can create, edit, and delete status entries for (Application ID, Email) and set a user-defined status text.

quotes: make australia work visa satatus check website when applicant can check visa application id and email

acceptanceCriteria: When authenticated, users can add a new status entry with Application ID, Email, and a status text value.
Users can edit an existing entry’s status text and save changes.
Users can delete an entry with a confirmation step.
The list updates after mutations (via React Query invalidation/refetch) without requiring a full page reload.

requirements.text: Add navigation so users can reach the "Australian Visa Check" screen from the existing app UI without editing immutable hook/provider files.

quotes: make australia work visa satatus check website when applicant can check visa application id and email

acceptanceCriteria: A clear navigation entry point to "Australian Visa Check" exists in the authenticated app experience (e.g., header or dashboard area).
If the user is unauthenticated, there is still a clear way to reach the check screen from the landing experience.
Navigation does not require modifying any files listed under frontend.immutablePaths.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; add backend/migration.mo only if existing stable state must be upgraded.
Do not integrate with any real Australian government/VEVO/ImmiAccount systems; the status check must remain mock and user-defined.
Do not edit files under frontend.immutablePaths (compose instead).
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: Implementing real visa status verification or scraping of official sites.
Adding third-party authentication providers (only Internet Identity is supported).
Adding external databases or non-Motoko backend services.
Adding real-time features such as WebSockets or push notifications.
